page.title: 08A DESCRIPTION OF ASTLEY
page.content: Up to 1932 it covered{2430}acres. Pre 1932 it was 2639 acres (2620 acres of land and 9 acres of water). {Population}1841 - 371 1911 - 377 1921 - 448 1931 - 304 The majority are living in the parish adjoining the expanding Bedworth and Smorrall lane area. The main settlement is 180m north of the Fillongley/Stockingford/Ansley and Bedworth crossroads. It consists of a church, a school, a castle and 14 brick and tile cottages. In 1830's it contained 14 named farms with 17 farming families. Hollybush farm was a public house. There was also a post office and a blacksmith, who was also a wheelwright and a shopkeeper. The main soil is red loam with cold west clay soil with sandstone subsoil. It is mainly open farming land with small patches of woodland.
